verse.name: c1a
verse.lines:
Such love,
such wondrous love,

Such love,
such wondrous love,

verse.name: c1b
verse.lines:
That God should love
a sinner such as I,

How wonderful
is love like this!

verse.name: v1a
verse.lines:
That God should love
a sinner such as I,

Should yearn to change
my sorrow into bliss,

verse.name: v1b
verse.lines: Nor rest till He had planned to bring me nigh,

How wonderful
is love like this!

verse.name: v2a
verse.lines: That Christ should join so freely in the scheme,

Although it meant
His death on Calvary,

verse.name: v2b
verse.lines: Did ever human tongue find nobler theme
Than love divine that ransomed me?

verse.name: v3a
verse.lines: That for a wilful outcast such as I,

The Father planned,
the Savior bled and died;

verse.name: v3b
verse.lines: Redemption for a worthless slave to buy,
Who long had law and grace defied.

verse.name: v4a
verse.lines: And now He takes me to His heart - a son,
He asks me not to fill a servant’s place;

verse.name: v4b
verse.lines: The “Far-off country” wand’rings all are done,
Wide open are His arms of grace.
